item.title: Silent Hill F Switch and Previous Gen Port Might Have Been Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
It seems like Silent Hill f might be coming to Switch and Switch 2, as well as previous-gen consoles, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One.

Silent Hill f was off to a spectacular start, with Konami announcing that the game’s cumulative worldwide shipment volume has exceeded 1 million units. It seems like they want to get this number even higher by bringing the game to new as well as previous-gen platforms.

Silent Hill f Might Be Coming to Switch, Switch 2, Xbox One, and PlayStation 4

If you head over to Konami’s website right now, click on their Games tab, and then select Silent Hill f. You will see the Switch and previous-gen port mentioned on that page. These details are mentioned twice, once in the ‘Platform’ section, which lists ‘Switch, Xbox One, Steam, PS4’. The second time in the ‘Games’ section, which lists PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X/S, Xbox One, PC, Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo Switch, iOS, Android, and for some reason, ‘Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG’ as well.

For those unaware of the title, Silent Hill f is a new instalment to the series, which blends psychological horror with a haunting Japanese setting. It is set in the 1960s, in the fictional small mountain town of Ebisugaoka; the characters and story were also created specifically for the game. Players have to embody the role of Shimizu Hinako as they explore this town, solve complex puzzles, and confront the distorted monsters.

The title features a “grotesque yet aesthetic world” with immersive 3D audio that enhances the tension and uneasiness. The title also features multiple endings where your choices shape your outcome. There are five endings that you can explore in total, and the store was written by the renowned author Ryukishi07 and features music by Akira Yamaoka.

In other news, a Microsoft Store leak has revealed the Xbox release date for Silent Hill 2. What are your thoughts on Silent Hill f coming to Switch, Switch 2, and previous-gen consoles? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Witcher 4 team acquiring Kingdom Come Deliverance 2’s lead gameplay designer. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: All Call Of Duty: Black Ops 7 Scorestreaks
item.content:encoded:
Ahead of the game’s release on November 14, Activision has revealed all of the scorestreaks available in Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 at launch.

These include a mix of classics like the RC-XD, Napalm Strike, and Sentry Turret as well as modern ones like Interceptors and Rhino. Players will be able equip three scorestreaks by default but can add a fourth with the High Roller Wildcard.

In total, there are 21 scorestreaks to choose from. Insider Gaming has the full list for you below, so check them out—all details come from Activision—and let us know which ones you are going to run with in multiplayer.

If you want even more Black Ops 7, you can check out the full list of launch weapons and equipment. And don’t forget to join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

Black Ops 7 Scorestreaks

Scout Pulse

Unlock Level: 1

Score Required: 350

Details: Radar ping that reveals nearby enemies on the user’s minimap.

RC-XD

Unlock Level: 5

Score Required: 400

Details: Deploy a small remote controlled, remote detonated explosive vehicle. 

UAV

Unlock Level: 11

Score Required: 500

Details: UAV recon ship that reveals enemy locations on the minimap.

Skewer

Unlock Level: 1

Score Required: 525

Details: Fire and forget air-to-ground projectile for precision eliminations. Bladed design minimizes collateral damage.

Care Package

Unlock Level: 26

Score Required: 550

Details: Call in an airdrop that contains a random Scorestreak.

Counter UAV

Unlock Level: 20

Score Required: 600

Details: A drone that scrambles all enemy minimaps.

Napalm Strike

Unlock Level: 33

Score Required: 700

Details: Launch a targeted carpet bomb strike of explosive napalm.

LDBR

Unlock Level: 38

Score Required: 725

Details: Launch a continuous bombardment of explosive shells at a targeted area.

Sentry Turret

Unlock Level: 21

Score Required: 750

Details: Automated turret that scans for and attacks nearby enemies in a forward-facing cone.

Hand Cannon

Unlock Level: 42

Score Required: 800

Details: Powerful large caliber handgun with high bullet damage and penetration.

Hellstorm

Unlock Level: 9

Score Required: 850

Details: Control a long-range cruise missile with boost capabilities and secondary missiles.

Watchdog Helo

Unlock Level: 23

Score Required: 950

Details: Close air support escort chopper that pings and attacks enemies in your area.

Gravemaker

Unlock Level: 17

Score Required: 1000

Details: Assemble a portable, one-hit-kill sniper rifle that can reveal and eliminate targets behind cover.

Interceptors

Unlock Level: 51

Score Required: 1025

Details: Call in a group of five jets to destroy enemy flying targets.

D.A.W.G.

Unlock Level: 1

Score Required: 1050

Details: Deployable Armored Weaponized Groundcraft featuring a large caliber turret and rocket pod. Very effective against infantry targets.

HKDs

Unlock Level: 30

Score Required: 1200

Details: Aerial payload delivers wheeled Hunter Kill Drones which seek targets and explode.

Rhino

Unlock Level: 54

Score Required: 1250

Details: Remotely control an armored robotic soldier equipped with a deadly minigun.

VTOL Warship

Unlock Level: 48

Score Required: 1350

Details: Control a VTOL Warship armed with a turret and air-to-land missiles.

HARP

Unlock Level: 47

Score Required: 1400

Details: High altitude recon vehicle reveals enemy position and direction on the minimap in real time.

EMP Systems

Unlock Level: 44

Score Required: 1450

Details: Massive electromagnetic pulse weapon disrupts enemies and destroys all hostile equipment and vehicles.

Legion

Unlock Level: 1

Score Required: 1500

Details: Large autonomous drone cluster patrols the skies, automatically seeking targets and exploding on impact.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: The Elder Scrolls 6 Release Is Still “A Long Way Off”
item.content:encoded:
If you were hoping for a release of The Elder Scrolls 6 anytime soon, you may want to sit down for this one. According to Bethesda’s Todd Howard, the latest game in the franchise is still “a long way off”.

In a recent interview with GQ to talk about Fallout 4’s 10th anniversary and other Bethesda happenings, Howard admitted that the game isn’t close to being ready for players.

“I’m preaching patience,” he said. “I don’t want fans to feel anxious.”

Howard said after raising money for Make-A-Wish that would see a character made in The Elder Scrolls 6, they had a three-hour play test of the game. He wanted to make clear though, that it wasn’t to signal that anything was close and that, if he has it his way, the announcement strategy would be a bit different.

“I like to just announce stuff and release it,” Howard said. “My perfect version – and I’m not saying this is going to happen – is that it’s going to be a while and then, one day, the game will just appear.”

When asked if he wanted it to be like The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remaster where it was shadow dropped in April, Howard didn’t rule it out.

“You might say that was a test run,” he said. “It worked out well.”

When do you think fans will get to play The Elder Scrolls 6, and do you think they would do a shadow drop release for such a highly anticipated game? Leave your thoughts down in the comments and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the list of nominees for the Best Score Soundtrack for Video Games and Other Interactive Media award at the 2026 Grammy Awards. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Strongman Ultra Codes (November 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Strongman Ultra monthly redeem codes for November 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Energy and Energy Gain Potions.

Strongman Ultra is a gym-based simulation experience on Roblox. To build a more muscular and toned avatar, you’ll need to lift weights, boost your cardiovascular fitness, and perform various exercises. Energy is the core resource that powers the gameplay. It determines how much your avatar can lift and how long they can keep training. Instead of grinding for hours to unlock new gym areas, you can easily redeem active codes to claim free Energy and Energy Potions. Use these rewards, hit the gym, and turn your gym rat into a full-fledged gym monster.  

Active Strongman Ultra codes

  • first – x250 Energy and x1 Energy Gain I Potion (Latest)
  • chad – x250 Energy and x1 Energy Gain I Potion (Latest)

Inactive Strongman Ultra codes

There are no inactive codes right now. If any active code expires, it’ll be added to this section. Players should hence redeem all the active codes quickly, as they run the risk of going inactive before major updates and specific milestones. 

How to redeem Strongman Ultra codes?

The steps featured below will help you redeem all the active codes this enjoyable Roblox experience:

  1. Launch Strongman Ultra and step into the server. 
  2. Select the red “SHOP” logo. 
  3. Click the old Twitter bird to open the code box. 
  4. Enter the active code into the “Enter code…” text box. 
  5. Hit the “Redeem” button to activate the code. 

Where to find new Strongman Ultra codes?

You can follow the developers’ X handle or join the game’s official Discord channel to learn about the new active codes. An easier alternative option is to keep track of our active codes list as they’ll be updated regularly. Bookmark this article to stay updated with all the active Strongman Ultra codes. If any of the active codes do not work, then let us know in the comments section. 

FAQs on Strongman Ultra codes

What are the latest codes?

chad and first are the new active codes. 

When are new codes released?

You can expect new codes released during special events, milestones, and in-game updates. 

How often do the active codes expire?

As of now, the active codes are expected to expire during new updates. Hence, redeem all the active codes before they go inactive.

Having fun using codes in Roblox games? Then check out the latest codes for 99 Nights in the Forest, Type Soul, and Azure Latch. Also, check out the Insider Gaming Discord server. 

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Anno 117: Pax Romana Release Date Explained—Exact Release Date & Start Time Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
They say all roads lead to Rome, and that is certainly the case as anticipation for the release date of Anno 117: Pax Romana rapidly approaches, and we’ve got all the important timings you need to dive in.

The first entry in the long-running series in six years, Anno 117: Pax Romana is deploying as the latest city-building simulator, thrusting you in control of a crucial point of history, and excitement for the title continues to rise.

Release dates and start times vary, so it’s worth noting exactly when Anno 117: Pax Romana is available in your region.

When is Anno 117: Pax Romana Coming Out?

Anno 117: Pax Romana is coming to PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S on November 13, and will also be available as part of a Ubisoft+ subscription.

The eighth instalment in the Anno series, and the first since Anno 1800 in 2019, Anno 117: Pax Romana continues the trend started by its predecessor of releasing on consoles—with the last release being the first time that has occurred in the main series.

Excitement for the title rose during the Steam Next Fest, when a demo of the game was available to play, and there isn’t too much longer to wait until the full release.

Do We Know The Anno 117: Pax Romana Start Time?

Anno 117: Pax Romana’s start times have been confirmed by Ubisoft, though the exact timing depends on your location in the world and your platform.

PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S have a staggered global release, becoming available to play from 12 AM local time, while PC has a global release at 3 PM PT on November 12—which means, for some players, the actual release date will be a day earlier than advertised.

The table below shows the start time on PC and consoles for Anno 117: Pax Romana in major time zones across the world.

Have you pre-ordered Anno 117: Pax Romana? Let us know if you’re planning to pick up the game in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For your next read, check out all the Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 launch weapons and equipment, and check out where to find bosses in Fortnite’s The Simpsons mini-season.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: All Call Of Duty: Black Ops 7 Launch Weapons And Equipment
item.content:encoded:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is finally here, and Activision has announced all of the weapons and equipment coming to the game’s multiplayer at launch.

This year’s game will launch with 30 weapons with a mix of popular types from Assault Rifles to Shotguns to Sniper Rifles. Each weapon has unique attributes and features that cater to a specific type of player. Regarding equipment, there are 27 options ranging from tactical to lethal to field upgrades.

Check out the full list of Black Ops 7 weapons and equipment below. Or you can jump directly to the category you want by clicking the appropriate link:

  • Assault Rifles
  • Submachine Guns
  • Shotguns
  • Light Machine Guns
  • Marksman Rifles
  • Sniper Rifles
  • Secondary
  • Melee
  • Equipment

And be sure to let us know what else you would’ve liked to see from the Black Ops 7 launch weapons and equipment down in the comments and be sure to join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

Black Ops 7 Launch Weapons

As mentioned, there are 30 launch weapons available to players in Black Ops 7. Breaking it down further, there are 23 primary weapons, five secondary, and two melees. You can check them all out for yourself below along with unlock details, attachment types, and more.

Primary Weapons

Assault Rifles

M15 MOD 0

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto assault rifle. Well-rounded with power, handling, and accuracy.

MXR-17

  • Unlock Level: 16
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Comb, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto assault rifle. High accuracy and range but has a slower rate of fire and mobility.

Peacekeeper M1

  • Unlock Level: 52
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto assault rifle. Higher mobility and handling at the cost of high recoil and limited range.

X9 Maverick

  • Unlock Level: 28
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Three-round burst rifle. Slow handling but has high damage and recoil control.

DS20 Mirage

  • Unlock Level: 37
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto assault rifle. Includes underbarrel grenade launcher.

AK-27

  • Unlock Level: 4
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto assault rifle. High Damage and low vertical recoil

Submachine Guns (SMGs)

Ryden 45K

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto submachine gun. Balance for close-quarters combat.

Dravec 45

  • Unlock Level: 34
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto submachine gun. Very low recoil but has lower damage.

Razor 9mm

  • Unlock Level: 19
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Stock Pad, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto submachine gun. High rate of fire but lower range.

Carbon 57

  • Unlock Level: 46
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto submachine gun. Higher ammo count but below average damage.

MPC-25

  • Unlock Level: 55
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto submachine gun. Very high damage, mobility, and handling but with lower range and high recoil.

RK-9

  • Unlock Level: 7
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Three-round burst submachine gun. Better for upper body and headshots.

Shotguns

M10 Breacher

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Pump-action charge shotgun

Echo 12

  • Unlock Level: 22
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Rechambering double-barrel shotgun

Akita

  • Unlock Level: 40
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto Shotgun

Light Machine Guns (LMG)

MK.78

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto light machine gun. High damage and ammo count

XM325

  • Unlock Level: 31
  • Attachment Types:  Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto light machine gun. Fast fire rate but has higher recoil.

Marksman Rifles

M8A1

  • Unlock Level: 10
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Four-round burst marksman rifle. High rate of fire.

Warden 308

  • Unlock Level: 25
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Comb, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Semi-auto Marksman Rifle. High damage with a double-action fire delay.

M34 Novaline

  • Unlock Level: 49
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Two-round burst Marksman Rifle

Sniper Rifles

VS Recon

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Stock Pad, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Bolt-action sniper rifle

XR-3 Ion

  • Unlock Level: 43
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Three-round burst sniper rifle

Shadow SK

  • Unlock Level: 13
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Comb, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Semi-auto sniper rifle

Secondary Weapons

Pistols

Jäger 45

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Semi-auto pistol

Coda 9

  • Unlock Level: 34
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto pistol

Velox 5.7

  • Unlock Level: 13
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Three-round burst pistol

Launchers

A.R.C. M1

  • Unlock Level: 25
  • Attachment Types: None
  • Details: Charge Launcher that delivers high damage to scorestreaks and vehicles.

AAROW 109

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: None
  • Details: Hybrid launcher. Locks on to vehicles and scorestreaks.

Melee Weapons

Knife

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: None
  • Details: Melee weapon with short range.

Flatline Mk.II

  • Unlock Level: 49
  • Attachment Types: None
  • Details: Melee weapon with short to moderate range.

Black Ops 7 Equipment

Moving on to equipment, there are nine tacticals, eight lethals, and 10 field upgrades to unlock and choose from.

Tactical

Stun Grenade

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Details: Slow’s victim’s movement and aiming.

EMP Grenade

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Details: Disables or destroys electronics.

Flashbang

  • Unlock Level: 15
  • Details: Blinds and deafens targets.

Pinpoint Grenade

  • Unlock Level: 8
  • Details: Grenade that detects enemies within its range.

Stim Shot

  • Unlock Level: 21
  • Details: Military stimulant that quickly heals combat wounds.

Psych Grenade

  • Unlock Level: 29
  • Details: Explodes on impact, releasing a lingering cloud of hallucinogenic gas.

Hunter Bot

  • Unlock Level: 42
  • Details: Personal defense drone hovers in air and targets enemy equipment, field upgrades, and scorestreaks. Can counter grenades.

Smoke

  • Unlock Level: 35
  • Details: Deploys a smoke screen that blocks vision and automated targeting systems.

Decoy

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Details: Grenade that simulates gunfire sounds.

Lethal

Frag

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Details Cookable fragmentation grenade.

Sticky Grenade

  • Unlock Level: 12
  • Details: Timed sticky grenade.

Cluster Grenade (Lethal)

  • Unlock Level: 5
  • Details: Grenade that scatters smaller explosives when detonated.

Combat Axe (Lethal)

  • Unlock Level: 54
  • Details: Throwing axe that kills in one hit.

Point Turret (Lethal)

  • Unlock Level: 33
  • Details: Small deployable sentry turret that automatically shoots at enemies, distracting and damaging them.

Needle Drone

  • Unlock Level: 18
  • Details: Small flying drone that explodes on impact. Can have auto or manual control.

C4 (Lethal)

  • Unlock Level: 41
  • Details: Large explosive that sticks to surfaces and can be detonated remotely when the equipment is depleted or immediately detonated.

Molotov (Lethal)

  • Unlock Level: 26
  • Details: Thrown incendiary weapon that creates a patch of flames.

Field Upgrades

Assault Pack

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Details: Extra ammo and equipment to resupply your team.

Drone Pod

  • Unlock Level: 6
  • Details: Deployable device that launches aerial drones. Drones seek out enemies and explode.

Trophy System

  • Unlock Level: 9
  • Details: Area defense system that destroys enemy projectiles in the air.

Active Camo

  • Unlock Level: 51
  • Details: Become partially invisible for a short period of time.

Echo Unit

  • Unlock Level: 27
  • Details: Holographic soldier decoy tricks enemies and captures and holds objectives.

Squad Link

  • Unlock Level: 20
  • Details: Deployed device that boosts score and improves effectiveness of allied Operators and gadgets in range.

Scrambler

  • Unlock Level: 45
  • Details: Disrupts nearby enemy equipment, field upgrades, scorestreaks, and minimaps.

Fear Trap

  • Unlock Level: 32
  • Details: Deployed trap which emits a neurotoxic gas cloud, causing severe hallucinations and disorienting victims.

Black Hat

  • Unlock Level: 38
  • Details: Field Upgrade that hacks enemies, equipment, and scorestreaks. Aim continuously at a target to hack it.

Mute Field

  • Unlock Level: 14
  • Details: Stealth device which gives you the Ninja, Ghost, and Cold Blooded Perks for a duration. The duration extends on kills.

For more Insider Gaming and Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, check out all of Zombies maps coming to the game at launch. There are even details on Zombies level unlocks that you may have missed. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
